one_reviews_text: Strong story, voice acting and some decent artwork. The closing credits artwork is especially good, although that's not really part of the main experience. Some "camera" cuts/transitions could be better and the overall artwork isn't as strong as it could be -- it relies heavily on black outlining of the characters and their features. If you're a comics fan then you'll see this as a good indy title, but it's definitely worth experiencing.

I love to just sit back & watch a movie (animation or otherwise), reasonable priced, cute animation. Just wish there are more of this kind, no shooting, no killing, no puzzle solving, no motion sickness.

There is about 30 minutes of story here, split into three chapters. For $5 I found this experience enjoyable enough, but not amazing. The characters are animated pretty well and there are a couple of neat moments in the fight scenes, but the environments are quite plain. I also couldn’t find any graphics options – this seems to have been ported over from console with few changes for PC. The story is just okay. It is clearly aimed at a younger audience (and I do think kids would enjoy this experience), but that doesn’t mean you can’t tell an interesting story for older viewers too! Look at ‘Avatar: The Last Airbender’ if you need proof of this. The third episode ends with a ‘To Be Continued’ screen, so it seems the creators are planning to continue the story at some point in the future. I will be interested to see where they take things.
